author: Christopher Middleton
title: CLA Game Fair 2015: what's on
text: You've got the lowdown on the CLA Game Fair , complete with its helicopter shuttle, but what else can you get up to while you're there? Dogs Dogs are central to the fair, with a variety of exhibits including international gun dog competitions, and experts from the Kennel Club on hand to offer advice to dog owners. Each day there will also be parades of hounds featuring local packs of foxhounds, fell hounds, harriers and beagles. The famous Blencathra Foxhounds will be parading on Sunday. Shooting With all types of shooting on display, you can compete yourself, see international competitors in action and shop for equipment. All sorts of fishing go on at CLA Game Fair (Geoff Pugh) Fishing A revamped fishing area will featuring hands-on activities that focus on mainstream fishing, with a special emphasis on youngsters and the next generation of anglers. Falconry Bird of prey experts will host flying demonstrations in the main arena as well as running the dedicated birds of prey area in the falconry village. The Game Fair is the perfect opportunity to learn all about the traditional hunt (Handout) Horse and hound Throughout the three-day show there will be six different types of hound on display, and visitors can learn all about hunting countries. Ferrets, pugs and drummers At the ferret roadshow you can see a range of ferrets and ferreting equipment. There are also displays including ferreting masterclasses. Peekaboo! (Geoff Pugh) Field archery Try your hand at this ancient sport, though the course-setter will try to outwit you at every turn. Kayak experience The all-new kayak area will feature leisure, sport and fishing kayaks, and the RNLI will be on hand with safety advice. You can try your hand at an array of activities at the Game Fair (David Burges) Families The popular and feature-packed active countryside area gives traditional country pursuits and activities an adrenalin-filled twist, plus clay shooting, bushcraft and survival. Main arena The Quack Pack is always a favourite, a sheepdog display given by champion handler Meirion Owen, using Indian runner ducks instead of sheep. Having watched a demonstration, members of the public are then invited to have a go. Champion gun dog trainer Ian Openshaw will be showcasing the essential skills and control of a dog in the shooting field, and the Shetland Pony Grand National is always a huge draw. Learn how to control a dog at a shoot at the Game Fair (Stephen Lock) Mitsubishi off-road driving experience Whether you want to drive a sporty crossover or an award-winning pickup truck, you can get behind the wheel on the off-road experience. Exploring nature Here you can meet the people working at the heart of the Great British countryside, try your hand at traditional country crafts and watch a range of demonstrations There's the opportunity to meet all sorts of people at CLA Game Fair (John Robertson) Schools shooting challenge The Schools Challenge is a group of events tailored to encourage under-21s into the sport and gain an all-round taste of shooting. It includes team competition clay, expert shooting tuition during the school holidays, and young handler gun dog days. The Great British village Celebrating the countryside, this new area will showcase the uniqueness, quality and variety of the Great British way of life and will include food and drink exhibitors, rural crafts, cultural traditions, country pursuits and fashion. Totally food show Cookery demonstrations will be held every day, with guests including television chefs Mike Robinson, Rachel Green and Jose Souto. The show will also feature the Game Chef of the Year Competition to find both amateur and professional chefs who enjoy the challenge of cooking with game and embrace the essence of the Great British Countryside in their food. Buy a ticket For Friday (£30), Saturday (£25), Friday and Saturday or Sunday (£50), all three days (£75). Call 0844 766 7777, or book online at gamefair.co.uk/campsite You can book a six-berth tent for three nights (£275) or a four-berth tent with double beds for £525. Ring 01883 717922, or book online via Honeybells, at honeybells.co.uk From £75 (single room) to £154 (double); 01572 770352 helicopters Leave your car at Bramham Park and fly to the fair in minutes; call 020 3012 0100 grab a hamper (feeds two) Either the Partridge hamper (£50, sandwiches, smoked salmon pate, bottle of wine) or the Grouse (£75, plus Scotch egg, and bottle of Prosecco) souvenirs Emma Bridgewater has designed a commemorative mug, adorned with the figures of a fisherman, shooter, gamekeeper, huntsman and hounds (£19.99) Follow @telegraph
